text: - Hi, I'm Iris.
I'm a Cloud Application Architect

with Professional
Services based in Munich.

I joined at AWS as part
of the graduate program
right after my master's degree.
So I studied information systems

which is a combination of
software engineering and business.
So I found then professional services
to really be fitting both of my interests.

I was always very interested
in cloud computing
so I took an university course
in cloud platforms in general,
and this is where I thought,
okay I really wanna innovate
on behalf of all the AWS customers.

My day-to-day role is actually
very customer focused.
So I work with professional services.
Is actually there to enable the customers
in their journey to the cloud.
And also modernizing afterwards.

I really wanted this people
to people conversations

and actually wanted that
as in my day-to-day job.
People at AWS are great.
You can always ask for advice.

You can always ask for
questions, people answer.
People love to teach others.

Especially after university
it's very important

to be in a place where you
have the support needed

for your own career development
so that you can learn.

So I'm part of a team
with actually great minds.
So they are very diverse.
I'm learning from them,

not only from the technical
day-to-day work that I do

but also from this cultural way
that they bring to the team.
And I'd say that even though
they weren't all my official mentors

they have all been mentoring
me since the start.
Everyone is so helpful.
You're always learn something new
in any interaction with a colleague.
(upbeat music fades)
